properties.Mission: A beautiful fine art gallery nestled in the foothills of the Sierras.

Art Obsessions officially opened its door in June 2011 in Truckee's Historic Downtown District. The gallery quickly gained recognition as a premiere source for the works of renowned regional and international artists and established itself as a primary source for limited edition prints. The gallery also features a superior collection of modern and traditional sculpture. Art Obsessions is known as a "must see" stop in Truckee's Historic Downtown District.
Art Gallery, Performance and Event Venue and Wine Bar

Located in the historic gold mining town of Grass Valley, California, the gallery is at the center of a vibrant visual and performing arts community.  Over 30 juried visual artists cooperate in presenting their work in this 19th century building.  The work includes ceramic, glass, jewelry, painting, woodturning, furniture, fiber art, metal, mosaic, mixed media, photography, and sculpture.

The Artists Studio in the Foothills (ASiF) is a 4000 sq. ft., fully-equipped studio art center. In 2008 ASiF opened its doors with a mission to nurture the creative spirit of the community, offer a professional studio atmosphere and creative home for visual artists by providing a place where are can be made, displayed and appreciated.  The center offers classes and workshops in a variety of media for all ages, private and shared studio space for working artists, and a gallery to promote local and visiting artists.

Founded in 2015, Atelier offers a collection of hand-sourced 2D prints, paintings and designer art wares and an exclusive collection of artist supplies and materials.  Atelier strives to be the creative hub of the local art community by hosting workshops taught by the area’s most sought after artists, illustrators, designers, weavers, knitters, painters and more who share the vision to create always and inspire all.

The Bolam Gallery was established in 2000 to bring world class fine art to the north shore of lake Tahoe. We represent the finest local and nationally acclaimed artists, specializing in traditional western subject matter reimagined with a modern viewpoint.
BriarPatch Food Co-op offers art exhibit space for the enjoyment of our customers and to promote local art.

This aesthetically pleasing display space for the visual arts features shows by local, regional, and international artists. The gallery also serves as an intimate venue for meetings, artist receptions, literary and dramatic readings. The space includes a concessions area and no-host bar.

A workshop space that showcases the creativity of its member artists. You'll find sculpture, jewelry, works on paper, fine art prints, antiquities, coins, mobiles, collage, mixed media, miniatures and music. The gallery also features the work of well known artists such as Picasso, Miro, Dali, Chagall and Matisse. There's always something new and interesting waiting just for you!

Ellu Gallery is a 2,200 sq. ft. artist owned collaborative gallery and event space. Ellu provides custom staging, commercial art lease programs and rents the gallery space for truly unique events and custom shows. Both private and public events are available. Hand selected artists versed in large scale one of a kind paintings and sculptures are featured at Ellu. Life is Art. Ellu Gallery breaks the old paradigm into a timeless lucid dream with an ever expanding collection from Zen surrealism, abstract, Expressionism, blown glass, wood sculpture, to hand made guitars.

Elixart is an herbal elixir lounge and visionary art gallery offering the highest integrity and highest vibration ingredients throughout our menu of mood-enhancing elixir drinks, kava, tea, and other exotics; raw food, and premium organic products.
The Emigrant Trail Museum contains exhibits about the cultural history of the area, including local Native Americans, the Donner Party, and building of the First Transcontinental Railroad.

Completed in the Spring of 1861, this firehouse was home to Nevada Hose Company No.1 from 1861 to 1938. During those nearly 80 years, horse -drawn fire wagons, handcarts and “modern” motorized fire engines rolled out the doors.

Gallery 5830′ is a creative portal, featuring an eclectic mix of artwork and furniture, hand crafted by artists in the local community and neighboring regions. Through our mission to connect clients with the creative community, Gallery 5830’ offers a selection of in house artwork for sale on consignment. Gallery 5830’ also facilitates artist/ client commissions that emphasize a collaborative vision, site-specific designs and refined old-world craftsmanship.
Our specialty is one-of-a-kind custom installations designed virtually from photos of your home, office or business.

St. Joseph's Cultural Center is a nonprofit organization dedicated to preserving a historic landmark for cultural activities in the community. It is owned and operated by the Historic Mount St. Mary's Preservation Committee.

JoAnne's Stained Glass Gallery in historic downtown Truckee is filled with beautiful stained glass stars, snowflakes and crystals. JoAnne's specializes in stained glass, leaded and beveled glass, sandblasted etched glass and fused art glass. Most of the stained glass and etched pieces are designed by JoAnne and fabricated in JoAnne's Truckee studio.

Truckee Donner Historical Society was founded July 24, 1968 to preserve the history of the Truckee Donner area. Besides maintaining the historic Joseph Research Cabin (the Gateway Cabin), the Society is also responsible for operating the Old Jail Museum which was built in 1875.  The Society maintains the Community Memorial Garden including the Memorial Arch behind the Old Jail Museum, the Donner  Cross, and Schaffer Cemetery.

Both natives of the tiny gold rush town of Nevada City, we became friends at age five and have been partners ever since. We have been blessed to inherit a super rad shop in an old drugstore on the main street in our lovely little town. We have vowed to sell only what we love: salt of the earth, mountain forest loving, unless desert escaping, vintage valuing, artisan constructed excellence without snobby artifice, all with California gold rush swagger.

Opened in July 2015, LeeAnn Brook Fine Art is one of the first artist-owned gallery and on site studio in Nevada County, California. Located at 231 Broad St, in the heart of historic downtown Nevada City, the gallery also incorporates the working studio of LeeAnn Brook, where visitors can see paintings in progress and discuss the art with the artist firsthand.

Lilly Vigil Gallery is located within the heart of the Sierra Nevada in beautiful downtown Nevada City, California. Since 1985, Vigil's is recognized for unparalleled quality of artistic and cultural treasures, focusing on fine Native American art. The gallery also specializes in originals, graphics, sculptors and exquisite jewelry from local, regional, and national artists.

Lorien Powers is an artist who specializes in creating industrial and contemporary style jewelry. Lorien prefers to work with gold, silver, natural gems, and minerals. Known for the decorative features of her work, she employs a wide variety of techniques, including roller printing, cold connecting, riveting, fabricating and forging. She draws inspiration for her jewelry from many different sources, some from nature, some from music (Phish in particular), some from industrial environments.

The Lucchesi Tasting Room is open from 11:00 am until the party's over, every day except Easter, Christmas, and Thanksgiving. Our summer hours are extended for special events, please call us for more information.

Morrison Hotel Gallery is the leader in Fine art music photography. With galleries in New York, Los Angeles and Maui our gallery represents over 130 of the best music photographers and artists. From the jazz photography of Billy Holiday, Miles Davis and the Blue Note collection to The Beatles, Rolling Stones and Bruce Springsteen to the contemporary artists of today, Morrison Hotel Gallery has every print for every taste in music.

Located at the Train Depot in historic Downtown Truckee, Mountain Arts Collective began in 2017, with three local artists who wanted to showcase quality art by individuals closely connected to the community. Our goal is to create a welcoming space that will attract locals and visitors with high end statement pieces, more affordable arts & gifts, and everything in between.
Hand forged iron work.

Located in Nevada City, California, the Nevada County Narrow Gauge Railroad and Transportation Museum is dedicated to the preservation of local transportation history and artifacts from the narrow gauge railroad era. Visitors are offered a docent led historical tour of the museum, rail yard, and restoration shop. There is no admission charge.

Our mission is to provide you, the customer, with an enjoyable full spectrum experience at our shop, whether in custom framing, art restoration, or fine art acquisition. Our friendly staff of experts is always ready to help you create a one of a kind, unique frame design. Stop by our gallery for art and gifts!
Our mission is to rehabilitate and transform the Historic North Star House into a premier cultural event center and to promote Nevada County’s legacy by fostering local arts, letters and sciences.

properties.Organization: North Star Power House & Pelton Wheel Museum
properties.Mission: The North Star Mining Museum, a part of the Nevada County Historical Society, is one of the gems of Nevada County and exists not only to preserve and protect our area’s mining heritage but also educates and informs people not only about the mining process, but also about the impact the industry had upon the humanity of the people who built the mines and those who toiled there during their operation.

Truckee’s historic jail museum is one of only a few surviving 19th-century jailhouses of its kind in the West and one of the few remaining original buildings in Truckee. The old Bastille was used continuously from 1875 until May 1964, and ably withstood the many fires that swept the town in its early days.  Although jails are usually sturdy, Truckee’s is a virtual strongbox. The original building consisted of just the lower level, constructed of native stone. The walls are 32-inches thick at the lower level, with no windows unless one counts the small vents for each cell, which are set with irregular rows of two-inch steel bars. The ceilings are plate steel, insulated with dirt, and lined with narrow gauge railroad tracks. All doors are riveted steel, weighing an estimated 200 pounds each.

The Miners Foundry Cultural Center is a living historic treasure serving Nevada County as a cultural arts and community events center.  More than a venue, the nonprofit’s mission is to preserve, enhance and utilize the historic Miners Foundry for cultural, educational and social activities in Nevada County.

Riverside Studios mission is to cultivate artistic growth in the Truckee Community while handcrafting one of a kind artistic goods, creating a unique shopping experience for both locals and tourists alike. From paintings to pottery, from leather goods to jewelry and metal sculpture there is something for everyone.

The Searls Historical Library is the archive of the Nevada County Historical Society.  Established in 1973, the Searls Library has become one of the premier libraries of materials on the area's history, people and mines which contributed to the development of this county.

Photographer and Truckee local Esteban Peralta has been taking photos since high school but recently decided to make a career out of his passion. Esteban feels the business name Sierra Color Studio appropriate as he lives in the Sierra Mountains and most of his photos are taken here.
Featuring a fairly traded, personally chosen collection of fine artisan jewelry, clothing and home decor, from the Hearts and Hands of Southeast Asia
Sierra Starr Vineyard and Winery is a small vineyard and winery in the Sierra Foothills AVA. Owned and operated by the Starr Family, Phil and Anne since 1995 and their son Jackson since 2005.
The Swan Levine House plays significantly into the history of Nevada County. The fine art of Printmaking is illustrated by the extensive collection of art throughout the house.

We offer Pottery, Candle Making, Paint & Sips, Wood Signs, DIY Bags and Pillows and Canvas Art, we also have a great retail section with art supplies. We are a place to come to make gifts, unique pieces for your home or just a place to come and get crafty.

If you believe in the visual pleasure of beauty, and that enhancing your environment enhances your life, we invite you to explore our diverse collection of stunning fine art photographs that celebrate the enduring beauty of our world. International award winning fine art photographers Olof and Elizabeth Carmel personally print, sign and number each of their limited edition fine art prints.

Our mission is to provide access to traditional and advanced tools, a large space and a variety of skill sets in a collaborative and innovative environment that enables the members to create what matters to them.

properties.Organization: The Louvre Framing, Restoration and Gallery
properties.Mission: Locally owned and operated, we provide top quality custom framing and art restoration. While you're in, visit our on-site gallery.

Truckee Railroad Museum is located next to the historic railroad station in downtown Truckee. This adds historical significance to the area, as the caboose is from the Southern Pacific Railroad and was used in the area. Paint for the caboose matches the original SP paint scheme. Inside the museum are stories, pictures, recreations, and railroad artifacts depicting the impact of railroads in the formation and development of Truckee. The First Transcontinental Railroad, Logging Railroads, and Tourism by Rail all played an important part in Truckee’s history.

properties.Organization: Truckee Tahoe Airport District (Art at the Airport)
properties.Mission: Since 1958, the Truckee Tahoe Airport District has been providing a high quality, safe facility for pilots, visitors and the community. Nestled in the Sierra Nevada mountain range at an elevation of 5,900 ft., twelve miles from Lake Tahoe, we promise one of the most scenic flight and visiting experiences in the world. We are proud of our pilot safety and community programs, state of the art energy saving facilities and top notch staff and leadership. We are committed to offering the best small, mountain airport in the Country.
A Garden Sanctuary Store featuring local artists Deborah Bridges, Jerrianne Van Dyk, Meg Black Smith, Jerry Delong and many others.

The Western SkiSport Museum was founded in 1969 by the Auburn Ski Club. Working with ski writer and historian William B. Berry, the Museum was developed as an exhibition of Western North American ski history. Today the Museum continues on a mission to collect, preserve and exhibit the history of winter ski sports in the western United States.

Wild Eye Pub gives customers great food, inspired drinks, and attentive service in a comfortable, art-filled space; a perfect place to connect with others, nurture creative ideas, and nourish body and spirit.

Stucki Jewelers specializes in every aspect of fine jewelry. We have a qualified and caring sales staff to help you find the perfect gift for that special loved one or that special something you have always wanted.  We also check and clean your jewelry complimentary, and offer a full service, onsite repair shop for all your repair needs.  By supporting Stucki Jewelers you support us in giving back to our local community, as we continue to donate to more than 45 local organizations

Nestled in the Sierra Nevada Foothills, Utopian Stone was founded in 1974 by G. Patrick Dyer and wife, Diane. We employ four master goldsmiths, plus a fifth, Dean Dussell, who works from his studio in Colorado. At Utopian Stone we specialize in high quality one of a kind work and customer commissions. Our favorite thing is to design for clients who have no idea what they want. As we do not reproduce our one of a kind creations, our customers challenge our designers who may want something similar to a one of a kind piece, but with its own unique personal flair
Swarovski Crystal Living, Swarovski Jewelry, Anna Leece Jewelry, Art Glass, Home Decor, Barware, Custom-made Jewelry, Shopping.
